intro: Spermacoce marticrovettiana, commonly known as the small cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, flat seeds. Spermacoce marticrovettiana is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
